Line Shading

Parameter Set
.

Description
..

This feature allows a shading correction in 1 dimension. It consists out of a multiplicative or a substractive shading correction of each pixel which works on a 8 bit output. The 1D shading feature together with 16Bit/Pixel output format is only available for medium applets.

Substractive shading correction:
An offset value can be loaded for each pixel. It will be subtracted from camera pixel at this place. The offset is normalized to values from 0.0 to 1.0, thus the offset is given in percentage. Negative result values will be clipped to zero. (Example: To substract the value 51 from an 8Bit/Pixel value the offset = 51/255 = 0.2)

Multiplicative shading correction:
A scaling value can be loaded for each pixel. The range for the multiplicative coefficent is from 0.0 to 2.0. If the result of the multiplication exceeds the maximum pixel value it is clipped. If all of the scaling values are be set to 1.0 the multiplicative shading correction has no effect.

Please read the according chapter of the manual of your camera, which output format is used.


Parameters
.

Shading Supported

Below the line shading entry you will find the shading supported field within the parameters table. This parameter sets the generally supported shading method. This means you can choose between only substractional shading, only multiplicational shading, both or none of it.

Subtraction Enable

Below the line shading entry you will find the substraction enable field within the parameters table. It is possible to enable and also to disable the substractive shading. This field will get accessable if the parameter shading supported has been set to substractional shading.

Multiplication Enable

Below the line shading entry you will find the multiplication enable field within the parameters table. It is possible to enable and also to disable the multiplicational shading. This field will get accessable if the parameter shading supported has been set to multiplicational shading.

Filename Multiplication

You are able to enter a multiplication file by right clicking onto this sub entry below the line shading entry within the parameters table.

Filename Subtraction

You are able to enter a substraction file by right clicking onto this sub entry below the line shading entry within the parameters table.

Load

After entering and activating a shading data set you are able to load the data from a set.

Please make sure that you've entered all the paths to your shading correction files (and also the file for Fixed Pattern Noise if it is set to on!) and also activated the corresponding shading data set before you load the data in special applets.

Clear

Clearing the uploaded shading data is only neccessary before loading new shading data.
.
